definitions.definition: a structure that is built over a river, road, or railway to allow people and vehicles to cross from one side to the other:
something that makes it easier to make a change from one situation to another:
examples: Part-time work can provide a bridge between staying at home and working full-time.

definitions.definition: to make the difference or division between two things smaller or less severe:
examples: We must bridge the gap between employees and management.
